subject: who am I?
event:
His fate is one that Derek Jacobi has tasted twice.

He knew Indiana Jones, has hung with droids and jedi, thrice contended for a Larry, winning once.  He's been a knight (often), an archbishop (twice), a dean, a priest, a doctor.

comments.article: Julian Glover is already Grand Maester Pycelle!

My first instinct is that it was someone who was in Star Wars and the Tudors, but I don't think such a person exists.  (And even if he did, odds are since I came up with that quickly it wouldn't be who you were hinting at anyway, you evil man ; )
And a stuttering Caesar!

Ahhh, I truly suck at this game! @_@  No matter how much I think or try to Google thinks up, I never come up with an answer. xD I guess I'll just have to wait until the answer is revealed, as usual. ^-^UU

another chilean fan?
chocale wn!
Julian Glover??

comments.article: Yeah, my guess is Julian Glover as well.
It would seem Cressen has been cast?  But I am not clever enough to tease out the rest.
Julian Glover is already Grand Maester Pycelle though...

LOL, maybe Julian Glover will pull double duty?

No, honestly, I can never make heads or tails of these things. I'm terrible. :( But does this mean they were in Indiana Jones and Star Wars? Or just Star Wars (since they would know "Indiana Jones" from working with Harrison Ford)....
I give up!
...given that Julian Glover is already playing Pycelle, it seems unlikely that he would be the subject of a Season 2 casting clue.
comments.subject: Ummm....

comments.article: julian glover, as whom, Stannis????  :D
Ian McDiarmid as Maester Cressen?

Derek Jacobi has played characters who were poisoned ("tasted") twice. If that's the character, sounds like Maester Cressen.

Julian Glover is already on the show, so he doesn't make sense as a casting clue...

Oliver Ford Davies? Right age, credits look right too...
Julian Glover.
Anthony Daniels?
comments.subject: Perhaps it is...

comments.article: He would make a good (aka pathetic) Cressen!  :-D
comments.subject: Re: Perhaps it is...

comments.article: Is it John Rhys-Davies?
That was my first thought. But God, I hope not.
So it isn't Julian Glover but is a Laurence Olivier Award winning actor. I really needed something to think about today. This is wonderful.
This is a wild guess, because I don't understand all the clues (and the Indiana Jones connection is tenuous), but - Liam Neeson?

Oliver Ford Davies? Wikipedia says he's been an archbishop twice, he was in Star Wars, he was in the Young Indiana Jones chroncile, he's been a deacon and a knight and a doctor and so on. And twice nominated for the Laurence "Larry" Olivier Award!

Given his age, I'd guess Cressen? He'd make a fine Ser Denys Mallister, too, if for some reason he was brought in early. Or Lord Hoster?
You might be a genius! I love it.

comments.article: David Warner as Craster? Just my gut feeling since he and Jacobi both played characters called Claudius ("I, Claudius" and "Hamlet")
